title: Revolutionary War Vocabulary
description: Learn the words and phrases of the American Revolution (1765-1783)

questions.question: During the American Revolution, what was a 'Patriot'?
options: A colonist who supported independence from Britain

questions.question: What was a 'Loyalist' (or 'Tory') during the Revolution?
options: A colonist who remained faithful to the British Crown
A member of a political party

questions.question: In Revolutionary War vocabulary, what were 'minutemen'?
options: Civilian militia members ready to fight at a minute's notice
Soldiers who served for one minute shifts

questions.question: What did 'no taxation without representation' mean?
options: Colonists should not be taxed by a parliament in which they had no voice

questions.question: During the Revolution, what was a 'Continental'?
options: Paper currency issued by the Continental Congress

questions.question: What was the 'Sons of Liberty' during the Revolutionary era?
options: A secret organization formed to oppose British taxation

questions.question: In Revolutionary vocabulary, what was a 'Redcoat'?
options: A British soldier, named for the red uniform

questions.question: What were 'Hessians' during the American Revolution?
options: German soldiers hired by Britain to fight against the colonists

questions.question: In Revolutionary War terms, what was a 'broadside'?
options: A large printed sheet used for public announcements or propaganda

questions.question: What did 'liberty pole' refer to during the Revolution?
options: A tall wooden pole erected as a symbol of freedom and resistance

questions.question: During the Revolution, what was 'quartering'?
options: Requiring colonists to house and feed British soldiers

questions.question: What was a 'musket' in Revolutionary War terminology?
options: A muzzle-loaded long gun used by soldiers

questions.question: In Revolutionary era language, what was a 'pamphlet'?
options: A short printed work used to spread political ideas

questions.question: What was 'Common Sense' in the context of the American Revolution?
options: Thomas Paine's influential pamphlet arguing for independence

questions.question: During the Revolution, what was a 'privateer'?
options: A privately owned ship authorized to attack British vessels
